alert.note: Alert for Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 4:32AM EDT until July 16 at 7:45AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM EDT THIS MORNING FOR WEST CENTRAL SUSSEX, WARREN, NORTHEASTERN NORTHAMPTON, AND EAST CENTRAL MONROE COUNTIES... At 432 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 1.5 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Easton, Forks, East Stroudsburg, Wilson, Washington, Blairstown, Bangor, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford, Alpha, and Hope. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 74 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey near mile marker 0. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 14. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 312 and 314. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
